intro: Leucas whytei, commonly known as the white leucas, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Leucas whytei is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
